org.openmuc.jdlms

Class TcpServerSap

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openmuc.jdlms.TcpServerSap

  • public class TcpServerSap
extends java.lang.Object
    The Server Service Access Point is used to start listening for DLMS/COSEM TCP client connections.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TcpServerSap(ServerEventListener serverEventListener)
      Use this constructor to create a ServerSAP that listens on port 4059 using the default ServerSocketFactory.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getMaxConnections() 
      int getPort() 
      javax.net.ServerSocketFactory getServerSocketFactory() 
      int messageFragmentTimeout() 
      void setMaxConnections(int maxConnections)
      Set the maximum number of client connections that are allowed in parallel.
      void startListening()
      Starts a new thread that listens on the configured port.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TcpServerSap

        public TcpServerSap(ServerEventListener serverEventListener)
        Use this constructor to create a ServerSAP that listens on port 4059 using the default ServerSocketFactory.
        Parameters:
        serverEventListener - the ServerConnectionListener that will be notified when remote clients are connecting or the server stopped listening.

    • Method Detail

      • messageFragmentTimeout

        public int messageFragmentTimeout()

      • setMaxConnections

        public void setMaxConnections(int maxConnections)
        Set the maximum number of client connections that are allowed in parallel.
        Parameters:
        maxConnections - the number of connections allowed (default is 100)

      • getMaxConnections

        public int getMaxConnections()

      • startListening

        public void startListening()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Starts a new thread that listens on the configured port. This method is non-blocking.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any kind of error occures while creating the server socket.

        public int getPort()
